MainCategory.Description: Technical Proficiency: Assesses the candidate's depth of knowledge and practical skills in relevant programming languages, frameworks, and tools essential for web development.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate the candidate's familiarity with specific languages (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python, Java, C++, C#), frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js), databases, and web services through targeted interview questions, code samples, and discussion of past projects.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited understanding of core web development technologies. Struggles with basic coding tasks and lacks familiarity with common frameworks or tools.
Functional knowledge of fundamental web development technologies. Can complete simple coding tasks with some guidance but requires assistance with more complex problems.

Solid understanding and practical experience with a range of web development technologies. Can independently develop and troubleshoot most web development tasks and exhibits a strong grasp of best practices.

Expert-level proficiency in multiple web development technologies. Demonstrates deep understanding, can solve complex problems efficiently, and actively contributes to improving team knowledge and processes.

MainCategory.Description: Problem-Solving Skills: Evaluates the candidate's ability to analyze complex technical issues, identify root causes, and implement effective solutions in a web development context.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Present the candidate with hypothetical web development challenges or bugs and assess their approach to diagnosing the problem, identifying potential solutions, and explaining their reasoning.  Review past projects for evidence of problem-solving capabilities.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Struggles to identify and analyze problems, relies heavily on others for solutions, and lacks a systematic approach to troubleshooting.
Can identify basic problems and follow established troubleshooting procedures with guidance. Requires assistance with more complex or novel issues.
Demonstrates strong problem-solving skills, can independently diagnose and resolve most web development issues, and proactively seeks out solutions.
Exceptional problem-solving abilities. Quickly identifies and resolves complex issues, anticipates potential problems, and proactively develops solutions to prevent them.

MainCategory.Description: Communication and Collaboration: Assesses the candidate's ability to effectively communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences, and to collaborate effectively within a team environment.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate the candidate's written and verbal communication skills during the interview. Assess their ability to explain technical concepts clearly and concisely. Explore their experience working in teams and their approach to conflict resolution.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Difficulty communicating technical information clearly and concisely. Struggles to collaborate effectively and may exhibit poor interpersonal skills.
Communicates technical information adequately but may struggle to explain complex concepts simply. Collaborates effectively in structured team environments.
Communicates technical information clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical audiences. Collaborates effectively and contributes positively to team dynamics.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills. Can effectively communicate complex technical concepts to diverse audiences and fosters a positive and collaborative team environment.

MainCategory.Description: Adaptability and Learning Agility: Determines the candidate's willingness and ability to learn new technologies and adapt to changing project requirements in the dynamic field of web development.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's history of learning new technologies, their approach to staying current with industry trends, and their ability to adjust to new project requirements. Look for examples of how they have adapted to changing situations in the past.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Resistant to learning new technologies and struggles to adapt to changing project requirements. Prefers to stick with familiar tools and approaches.
Willing to learn new technologies but requires significant guidance and support. Adapts to changing project requirements with some difficulty.
Demonstrates a strong desire to learn new technologies and adapts quickly to changing project requirements. Proactively seeks out new information and skills.
Exceptional adaptability and learning agility. Quickly masters new technologies and thrives in dynamic environments. Actively seeks out opportunities to expand their knowledge and skills.

SubCategory.Description: Front-End Development Skills: Focuses on the candidate's expertise in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and related front-end frameworks for creating user interfaces and interactive web experiences.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript through technical questions and code samples. Evaluate their familiarity with popular front-end frameworks like React, Angular, or Vue.js. Check understanding of responsive design principles.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Struggles with basic front-end development tasks.
Functional knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Can complete simple front-end development tasks with some guidance.
Solid understanding and practical experience with front-end development technologies. Can independently develop and troubleshoot most front-end tasks.
Expert-level proficiency in front-end development technologies. Demonstrates deep understanding of best practices and can solve complex problems efficiently.

SubCategory.Description: Back-End Development Skills: Measures the candidate's proficiency in server-side programming languages, databases, and APIs for building and managing web applications.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's knowledge of server-side programming languages like Python, Java, PHP, or Node.js. Evaluate their experience with databases (SQL, NoSQL) and their ability to design and implement APIs. Check their understanding of server-side security principles.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited understanding of server-side programming languages, databases, and APIs.
Functional knowledge of server-side technologies. Can complete simple back-end tasks with guidance.
Solid understanding and experience with back-end development technologies. Can independently develop and troubleshoot most back-end tasks.
Expert-level proficiency in back-end development. Demonstrates deep understanding and can solve complex server-side problems efficiently.

SubCategory.Description: Web Services and API Knowledge: Evaluates familiarity with web services (REST, SOAP) and APIs, including design, implementation, and integration with web applications.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Ask the candidate to explain the difference between REST and SOAP APIs. Assess their understanding of API design principles and their experience integrating with third-party APIs. Evaluate their ability to troubleshoot API integration issues.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Little to no knowledge of Web Services and API's.
Basic understanding of Web Services and API's, knows what they are used for.
Solid understanding and experience integrating with Web Services and API's
Deep understanding and experience building/troubleshooting Web Services and API's

SubCategory.Description: Version Control (Git): Assesses experience with Git for version control, including branching, merging, and resolving conflicts in a collaborative development environment.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Ask the candidate about their experience with Git.  Assess their understanding of branching and merging strategies.  Explore their ability to resolve merge conflicts effectively. Check if they can explain the advantages of using Git.

ScoringGuided.Comment: No practical knowledge of version control systems or Git.
Basic understanding of version control concepts and Git commands.
Comfortable using Git for branching, merging, and basic collaboration.
Deep expertise with Git, including advanced branching strategies and conflict resolution.

SubCategory.Description: Database Management: Evaluates experience with database management systems (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB) including design, querying, and optimization.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Ask about experience with different database management systems. Assess their knowledge of database design principles and SQL querying. Explore their understanding of database optimization techniques.

ScoringGuided.Comment: No knowledge of database management systems
Basic understanding of database systems and can execute simple queries
Experience designing and querying databases, can perform basic optimization.
Expert level understanding of database management, can create complex schemas, efficiently query, and optimize.
